Starting a Project Easier

This page is an introduction into the tools and frameworks used by the Interactive Development to scaffold their projects and instantiate their projects quickly. The page will do a brief synopsis of the most used frameworks and include steps for their installation.

Yeoman

Yeoman combines open source tools and streamlines aspects of the web development process. Yo will set up the basic webapp file structure for you, through one line in the terminal.

More instensive frameworks, such as Angular, can also be built through Yo.

Grunt

Grunt handles automative tasks like minification, compiliation, etc.

Grunt is mostly used to build and clean projects and setting up a localhost. Every Gruntfile has a livereload task which will refresh the application as soon as the files is saved in the IDE.

Bower

Bower fetches and installs packages and libraries from open-sources and keeps track of the packages in compiled file, bower.json.

Bower along with NPM speeds up the creation progress. They download and manage your scripts, so you don't have to do it manually.

Node.js

Node.js is the first and foremost tool to install.

Node.js handles the installation of open source applications through NPM, the package manager for the Node.js server platform.

Node functions as a warehouse of third-party applications, while NPM not only delivers the packages but installs the code and manages the code dependencies. All node_module installations are run through the command line.

1. Travel to https://nodejs.org/

2. Click the install button and follow the directions

3. Make sure the package is installed into /usr/local/bin

Checkout their website for more information

Yeoman

Yeoman scaffolds high quality working web applications. Most projects made by the development team are first built by Yeoman.

Yeoman combines several functions e.g., creating a starter template, managing dependencies, and providing a local development server. Angular, Assemble, Backbone are the types of projects, but not limited to, that can be instantiated through Yeoman.

1. Open the terminal

$ npm install -g yo bower grunt-cli

Grunt and Bower are components of Yeoman, no extra installation is needed. When Yo creates a projects, a Gruntfile.js and bower_components.json are instantiated.

Checkout their website for more information

Sass

Sass is a stable, powerful CSS extension, such as allowing mechanisms availble in OO languages.

Sass supports variable declaration, nesting, mixins, arguments, and selector inheritance.

1. Open the terminal

$ gem install sass

**Gem should be preinstalled on Macs

2. If you get an error message, then use the sudo command to install the Sass gem

$ sudo gem install sass

3. Check installation

$ sass -v

The terminal should print out Sass 3.4.13

Checkout their website for more information

Handlebars.js

Handlebars build semantic templates.

Handlebars.js is compatible with Mustache.js, but can handel extensibility and minimal logic with #if, #unless, #with, and #each helpers.

Handlebars does not provide a global installation, but can be downloaded from handlebars.com or be installed through Bower.

To Manually install Handlebarsjs:

1. Go to the website http://handlebarsjs.com/

2. Click the provided download button

The files will need to be added to the scripts folder in the project manually.

For Bower install, open the terminal

$ bower install handlebars

or

$ bower install https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/

If you created an assemble project, handlebars files have already been imported.

Checkout their website for more information
